channel.title: Radio Drama Revival!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Showcasing the diversity and vitality of modern audio theater
channel.itunes:author: Frederick Greenhalgh
channel.itunes:summary: Tired of the same old news, talk and music? Need something to get you through that midafternoon slump? Then tune in to Radio Drama Revival! the show dedicated to stories told through the medium of sound, showcasing the diversity and vitality of the modern scene. Radio Drama Revival! airs on WMPG 90.9/104.1 in Portland, Maine USA 1-1:30PM EST Thursdays -- podcasts up on Friday.
channel.description: Tired of the same old news, talk and music? Need something to get you through that midafternoon slump? Then tune in to Radio Drama Revival! the show dedicated to stories told through the medium of sound, showcasing the diversity and vitality of the modern scene. Radio Drama Revival! airs on WMPG 90.9/104.1 in Portland, Maine USA 1-1:30PM EST Thursdays -- podcasts up on Friday.

item.title: Radio Drama Revival - Episode 1
item.description: Episode 1 - Listen to Drizzle by Frederick Greenhalgh, voice actor Philip Hobby in the studio

item.title: Radio Drama Revival - Episode 3
item.description: Episode 3 - Frederick chats with Scott Hickey about World Horror Con, growing up with audio drama, and the making of "God of the Razor."

item.title: Radio Drama Revival - Episode 4
item.description: Episode 4 - The first half of Quicksilver Radio Theater's "Good Friday, 1865: Lincoln's Last Day" a historical drama of the last hours of Abe Lincoln.

item.title: Radio Drama Revival - Episode 5
item.description: Episode 5 - The conclusion of Quicksilver Radio Theater's "Good Friday, 1865: Lincoln's Last Day" a historical drama of the last hours of Abe Lincoln.

item.title: Radio Drama Revival - Episode 6
item.description: Episode 6 - Chat with Craig Wichman and Jay Stern of Quicksilver Radio Theater
